quit.quitting: Quitting... Please wait for data to save

default.description: Navigate using the sidebar in order to modify settings
default.title: Welcome to the moss settings.

debug.footnote: Please turn off any debug options that modify the UI, as a final check up on the elements, before finalizing changes.
debug.title: Main debug options

toggle.footnote: Global debug mode for logs or other options
toggle.label: Enable debug mode

toggle_alignment.footnote: This refers to the notebook lines file rendering and the way that rm_lines tries to align the whole page to a common center
toggle_alignment.label: Disable LINES alignment

toggle_button_rects.footnote: This adds a condition to the UI to show the rect of every button at the end of the loop. Each button is outlined in red, some rects may be wrong. This is useful for debugging button alignment issues.
toggle_button_rects.label: Show button rects

toggle_lines_log.footnote: This enables detailed logs for every stroke and item during LINES page rendering. It gets messy be aware!
toggle_lines_log.label: Enable debug log for LINES renderer

toggle_log.footnote: Weather or not to initiate logs in the terminal on startup
toggle_log.label: Enable debug logs

toggle_orphans.footnote: This will show any documents or collections that have a missing parent.
toggle_orphans.label: Enable orphans

toggle_viewer.footnote: This enables info UI for the document viewer. It's useful for debugging issues with alignment or scale.
toggle_viewer.label: Enable document viewer debug

debug.warning: Some of these require a restart to take effect!

debug_exports.description: These options are for debug exports on documents
debug_exports.title: Debug export options

toggle_raw.footnote: This sorts and prettifies any metadata or content files
toggle_raw.label: Enable RAW export

toggle_raw_ext.footnote: Whether to include .json at the end of metadata or content files
toggle_raw_ext.label: Add extension to RAW exports

developer.description: Here you can find all the settings related to debugging Moss or experimental features
developer.title: Developer Settings

missing_template.description: Moss could not find the following menu.
missing_template.info: If you think this is a mistake, please raise an issue!
missing_template.title: Menu missing!

moss.description: You will find all the settings related to Moss here.

toggle_portable.footnote: This disables the installer screen on startup and allows you to run from an extracted folder without installing.
toggle_portable.label: Portable mode

toggle_statistics.footnote: This allows tracking usage statistics. As of currently this data is not shared but may be accessed by extensions.
toggle_statistics.label: Allow statistics

toggle_download_everything.footnote: This option downloads any documents that are visible in the main menu and were not downloaded before.
toggle_download_everything.label: Download everything

toggle_download_last_page.footnote: This feature downloads only the necessary data to create a preview thumbnail of the document, without having to open it.
toggle_download_last_page.label: Download last page to make preview

toggle_save_doc.footnote: This option causes the document to be uploaded after closing the document viewer. This will update data such as the current page or last opened.
toggle_save_doc.label: Save after closing a document

toggle_save_path.footnote: Enabling this will maintain the currently opened folder, every time you open the app. If you disable this it will maintain whichever folder it last saved. The default folder is "My Files".
toggle_save_path.label: Save last opened folder

toggle_wait_for_everything.footnote: This may lead to increased load times, depending on the size of your cloud.
toggle_wait_for_everything.label: Wait for everything to load

moss.title: Moss Settings

toggle_fake_refresh.footnote: This is a deprecated feature, where some UI interactions cause the screen to do a fake eink refresh. This feature may be disturbing to some users or otherwise annoying.
toggle_fake_refresh.label: Enable fake screen refresh

toggle_maintain_aspect.footnote: This will keep documents loaded in the document viewer sized to the original window size. If you disable this, the page size will instead try to scale to whatever window size you have instead, if you resized the window.
toggle_maintain_aspect.label: Maintain aspect size
